abstract: Commercial Metals, a metal recycler, rejected a proposed takeover by the billionaire investor Carl C. Icahn, calling his offer, which values the company at $1.7 billion, a “bargain basement price.”
snippet: Commercial Metals, a metal recycler, rejected a proposed takeover by the billionaire investor Carl C. Icahn, calling his offer, which values the company at $1.7 billion, a “bargain basement price.”
lead_paragraph: LONDON — The Commercial Metals Company on Monday rejected a proposed takeover by the billionaire investor Carl C. Icahn, calling his offer, which values the company at more than $1.7 billion, a “bargain basement price.”
